reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed here for two nights while exploring the Ring of Kerry, the Dingle Peninsula, and the nearby towns of Killarney and Kenmare. The location is wonderful, with a senic view of the river in front of the B&B and lots of parking. We had a ground floor room (#9 if I recall) with a small sitting area overlooking the river. Our room was larger than average and the bathroom was good – lots of hot water – but not especially attractively decorated.
reviews.title: Wonderful B&B

reviews.text: The hosts were very friendly and helpful with directions and suggestions. Breakfast in the morning was abundant and quick, although we spent a bit of time visiting with other guests and heard Shawn from New Jersey’s story first hand. The location is great for several days of exploring – I just wish we had more time. We would stay here again!
reviews.title: A very Personal experience

reviews.text: I came upon this B&B by chance. I had a very bad day, cut my knee at the cliffs, almost got hit head on and crashed my car. So I must have been a sight for Finnbarr. He was so kind and reassuring took care of my knee, called a restaurant for me so I could get something to eat, and when I returned from dinner he had put a hot water bottle in my bed to warm it up. The next morning I met Anne his lovely wife, she's a breath of fresh air and a ray of sunshine. Finn and Ann looked after me as if I were there own family. The Coffey house is beautiful overlooks a river and you can see the mountains in the distance. I can only say they are not just proprietors of a business, they treat everyone with such attentive care that you end up feeling like you're part of their family. I fully intend on returning to visit them again.
reviews.title: Outstanding stay in killorglin

reviews.text: Just returned home from 4nights in killorglin where we stayed at coffeys rivers , everything was top class ,Anne was a great hostess and made sure we got a great breakfast everyday , Fin was great with his recommendations of where to go each day , we would highly recommend this establishment to anyone looking for a base to tour ring of Kerry and the dingle peninsula
reviews.title: Warm Hospitality, Great Town

reviews.text: We recently stayed at Coffey's. Ann and Finbarr made us feel right at home and very welcome. They were very helpful pointing us to "where the fun is" in town and the good spots to eat. They also pointed us to some great spots to visit on the Ring of Kerry and Dingle Peninsula. The rooms are fine - typical B&B rooms, slightly outdated furnishings and bathroom facilities, but clean and tidy. I would go back.
reviews.title: Very friendly, good location
